bibl.title: William Martz v. J.H. Whitcourt. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In obedience to the annexed writ I herewith being the within named W. F.C. Martz before your Honor, and that I hold him by virtue of a warrant of Com- mitment of which the annexed is a true copy
Territory of Washington County of Pacific

Upon the Sheriff of said County, whereas Hiram Wing has notified me in writing and Hiram W. Paulding personly that they will not be responsible for the conduct of W.C.F. Martz, therefore you are commanded to arrest him and keep him in custody in said jail and there keep him until he be discharged by due process of law this 11th day of Dec A.D. 1875 Geo W. Wilson Justice of the Peace J.H. Whitcourt Sheriff of Pacific County
Territory of Washington County of Pacific

For the Sheriff of said County whereas Hiram Wing has notified me in writing and Hiram W Paulding personly that they will not be responsible for the conduct of W C F Martz Therefore you are commanded to arrest him and keep him in custody in said jail and there keep him until he be discharged by due course of law
This 11 day of Dec AD 1875 Geo W Wilson Justice of the Peace
I hereby certify the foregoing to be a true copy of the assigned which was put unto my hand, for
J H Whitcourt Sheriff of Pacific Co WT
In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Kalama in the county of Cowlitz W.T.
The clerk will an order of discharge in
Filed in the District Court this 3rd day of March AD. 1876
O.F. Bill for Atty for Martz
